skill.name: busco-phylogeny
skill.description: Generate phylogenies from genome assemblies using BUSCO/compleasm-based single-copy orthologs with scheduler-aware workflow generation
skill.summary: Generate phylogenies from genome assemblies using BUSCO/compleasm-based single-copy orthologs with s...
skill.author: brunoasm

security_audit.summary: Legitimate phylogenomics workflow generator. All 1005 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES representing standard bioinformatics practices: external tool invocations (compleasm, MAFFT, IQ-TREE, ASTRAL), NCBI API access, and filesystem operations for genome assembly processing. Author is Bruno de Medeiros (Field Museum). No malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: Building phylogenetic trees from multiple genome assemblies requires complex workflows with many tools. This skill generates ready-to-run, scheduler-aware scripts for the complete BUSCO-based phylogenomics pipeline.
actual_capabilities: Generates complete phylogenomics workflows from genome assemblies
Creates scheduler-specific scripts for SLURM, PBS, and local machines
Downloads genomes from NCBI by BioProject or Assembly accession
Aligns single-copy orthologs and trims alignments with multiple methods
Builds concatenated ML trees and ASTRAL coalescent species trees
Writes draft methods paragraphs for publications with citations
limitations: Requires external tool installation (compleasm, MAFFT, IQ-TREE, ASTRAL)
Does not run workflows directly - generates scripts for user execution
Quality of results depends on genome assembly completeness
Lineage dataset selection requires user knowledge of taxonomic group

use_cases.title: Build species phylogenies
use_cases.description: Generate phylogenetic trees from genome assemblies for published evolutionary studies.

use_cases.title: Automate phylogenomics pipelines
use_cases.description: Create reproducible workflows for ortholog extraction, alignment, and tree inference.

use_cases.title: Learn phylogenomics workflows
use_cases.description: Follow step-by-step guidance through the complete BUSCO-based analysis pipeline.

prompt_templates.title: Basic phylogeny request
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to generate a phylogeny from 20 genome assemblies on a SLURM cluster

prompt_templates.title: NCBI genome download
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me find and download beetle genome assemblies from NCBI by taxon name

prompt_templates.title: Custom workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate scripts for a PBS cluster with 48 cores using Aliscore trimming and Q.insect model

prompt_templates.title: Quality validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the generated scripts and provide quality control recommendations for the BUSCO results

output_examples.input: I need to generate a phylogeny from 15 insect genome assemblies on a SLURM cluster
output: Setup script for conda environment with all required tools
Questions about lineage dataset, CPU allocation, and trimming method
Scripts for Step 2 (compleasm), Step 5 (MAFFT), Step 6 (trimming), Step 8 (IQ-TREE and ASTRAL)
Quality control recommendations for BUSCO results

output_examples.input: Download genomes from NCBI BioProject PRJNA12345 and build a plant phylogeny
output: Command to download genomes using NCBI datasets CLI
Script to rename downloaded files with species names
Step-by-step workflow from BUSCO to final species tree

best_practices: Use RefSeq assemblies (GCF_*) when available for higher quality reference data
Start with Step 0 environment setup to install all required tools in one unified conda environment
Validate all generated scripts before running them on your computing cluster
anti_patterns: Do not run scripts without validating the command-line options first
Avoid skipping quality control - assess BUSCO completeness before proceeding to alignment
Do not use the same CPU allocation for all steps - first compleasm job needs full resources for database download

faq.question: What computing environments are supported?
faq.answer: SLURM clusters, PBS/Torque clusters, and local machines with GNU parallel or serial execution.

faq.question: Can I use both local files and NCBI accessions?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports mixed input. Download NCBI genomes first, then rename all files consistently.

faq.question: What trimming methods are available?
faq.answer: Aliscore/ALICUT (thorough), trimAl (fast automated), BMGE (entropy-based), or ClipKit (modern).

faq.question: How do I choose a BUSCO lineage dataset?
faq.answer: Select the most specific lineage for your taxonomic group. See references/REFERENCE.md for the complete list.

faq.question: What substitution models does IQ-TREE use?
faq.answer: Nuclear (LG, WAG, JTT, Q.pfam), mitochondrial (mtREV, mtZOA), or taxonomically-targeted models (Q.insect, Q.mammal).

faq.question: Does the skill run the analysis?
faq.answer: No, the skill generates ready-to-run scripts. You copy and execute them on your computing environment.
